info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 9:27AM CDT until June 18 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 AM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN CADDO AND CENTRAL BOSSIER PARISHES... At 926 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Belcher, or 14 miles north of Shreveport, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Blanchard, Benton, Oil City, Mooringsport, Belcher, Gilliam, Fosters, Dixie, Alden Bridge, Rocky Mount, Caddo Lake, Ferguson, Linton, Cross Lake, Cavett, Barksdale Air Force Base, Ivan and Bethany. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
